message_1: What is the smallest non-negative quadratic residue of 17?
message_2:
A quadratic residue is a number that is a perfect square modulo a given modulus. In this case, the modulus is 17. To find the smallest non-negative quadratic residue, we can start by checking the squares of the numbers from 0 to 16 (inclusive) modulo 17.

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 17)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 17)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 17)
3^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
4^2 ≡ 16 (mod 17)
5^2 ≡ 8 (mod 17)
6^2 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
7^2 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
8^2 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
9^2 ≡ 13 (mod 17)
10^2 ≡ 15 (mod 17)
11^2 ≡ 2 (mod 17)
12^2 ≡ 8 (mod 17)
13^2 ≡ 16 (mod 17)
14^2 ≡ 9 (mod 17)
15^2 ≡ 4 (mod 17)
16^2 ≡ 1 (mod 17)

The smallest non-negative quadratic residue of 17 is 0.
